page.title: 06Riverside Lake at Lexham
page.content: The area attracts a share of{tourism and one of the most attractive features to be found in the{landscape is the lake on the River Nar at East Lexham. This was man made as a fish farm centuries ago, but has now largely become natural.During July 1985 it measured approximately 150 metres long and 20 metres wide.It was estimated to be 3 metres deep at the centre.In the water there can be found a variety of fish including trout, tench and carp.People use the lake for {recreation}as fishing licences can be obtained from Lexham Hall estate. Although some evidence of pollution was found in the form of an old car battery and litter, in general the {ecology}is well protected.
